info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 1:10PM EDT until September 30 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Berkeley County in southeastern South Carolina... Charleston County in southeastern South Carolina... Dorchester County in southeastern South Carolina... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 105 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a band of torrential rainfall from the Charleston Airport along Interstate 26 to around Summerville. This band has produced 4 to 6 inches of rain so far today. This band is expected to linger into the mid afternoon, producing an additional 2 to 4 inches. Reports from the public indicate several roads from Goose Creek to Ladson were reported flooded. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, I-26/I-526 Interchange, West Ashley, Daniel Island, Crowfield Plantation, College Park, Charleston Airport, Sangaree, Magnolia Gardens, Knightsville, Lincolnville, Charleston Southern University, Otranto, Northwoods Mall and Driggerstown. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
